author: Special Correspondent
text:
Union Minister for Environment and Forests Prakash Javedakar releasing the second annual report on “Vision Carbon Neutral” by Young Indians and Forest College and Research Institute.-Special arrangement

Young Indians and Forest College and Research Institute have released the second annual report on ‘Vision Carbon Neutral’ - a programme for environment related institutions primarily to reduce their emissions, absorb them, reduce waste and recycle the same through various measures such as vermin-composting and microbial composting.

This initiative was started with the blessings of late former President APJ. Abdul Kalam as the Carbon Neutral City was his dream.

The document was released by Union Minister for Environment, Forests and Climate Change Prakash Javedakar.

Environment training

Environment training was given to teachers and students through lectures and field trips. Students witnessed organic waste recycling methods. Exhibitions and jungle trips were organised for public awareness.

The first phase with 10 schools had been completed. Around 10-15 thousand students were directly involved. Any institution interested to take part in the programme can contact 0422-4044555.
title: Vision Carbon Neutral report released
